thread.title: Timberwolves' Zach LaVine will miss rest of season with torn ACL
thread.title_full: Timberwolves' Zach LaVine will miss rest of season with torn ACL

author: Jordan Greer (jgreer@sportingnews.com)
title: Timberwolves' Zach LaVine will miss rest of season with torn ACL
text:
February 4, 2017 5:36pm EST February 4, 2017 5:36pm EST LaVine is Minnesota's third-leading scorer this season behind Andrew Wiggins and Karl-Anthony Towns. Timberwolves guard Zach LaVine (Getty Images) 
Updated at 5:36 p.m. ET 
Updated at 5:36 p.m. ET 
Timberwolves fans won't be seeing those trademark high-flying dunks from Zach LaVine any time soon. 
The team announced Saturday that LaVine will miss the remainder of the 2016-17 season after suffering a torn ACL in his left knee during Minnesota's loss Friday night to the Pistons. LaVine is the Timberwolves' third-leading scorer this season (18.9 points per game) behind Andrew Wiggins (22.1) and Karl-Anthony Towns (23.0). 
FLASHBACK: Gordon and LaVine gave us one incredible Dunk Contest 
The former first-round pick has progressed in each of his three years in Minnesota and become a key player as part of the young Timberwolves' foundation. He is shooting 45.9 percent from the field and holds a 54.4 effective field-goal percentage, both career highs. 
The Timberwolves have yet to announce when LaVine will undergo surgery. Watch This
